fields.description:
ACAS stands for Advisory, Conciliation and Arbitration Service. The ACAS helpline answers employment questions confidentially by phone. It takes queries from employers, employees and others on a wide range of employment law matters. 

The ACAS helpline offers general legal information only - they don't give advice on specific situations. ACAS will provide a free conciliation service known as pre-claim conciliation for workplace problems that can't be resolved in-house and are likely to become employment tribunal claims.
fields.accessibility: Text relay and Welsh helpline service available.Website has range of features including read aloud service and resizeable text.
fields.when_to_use: Clients seeking legal advice for out of scope employment and discrimination problems
fields.how_to_use: Refer those who wish to self help to website. Refer those needing guidance to helpline.
fields.keywords: employment, helpline, employers, contract, tribunal, grievance, employee, redundancy, misconduct, maternity, redundant, dismissal, wage, helpline, stress, absence, ACAS, acas

fields.description:
AVMA promotes better patient safety and seeks justice for those affected by a medical accident or clinical negligence. 

Medically and legally trained caseworkers provide free and confidential support following a medical accident. This includes rights advice, referral to solicitors and other practical and emotional support. 

The AVMA website features a range of specialist leaflets, as well as an online solicitor search.
fields.accessibility: Website available in Welsh
fields.when_to_use: Clients on a low income seeking legal advice after a medical accident.
fields.how_to_use: Refer those wishing to self help to website, those who wish to speak to to someone to helpline.
fields.address:
Action against Medical Accidents
Freedman House
Christopher Wren Yard 
117 High Street
Croydon     
CR0 1QG
fields.keywords: action, medical, accidents, negligence, clinical, doctor, nurse, gp, nhs, hospital, surgery, injury, patient, avma, helpline

fields.description:
Business Debtline (BDL) is a charity that provides free, confidential and independent debt advice for the self-employed and small businesses. The website contains factsheets and sample letters. 

Note: No post or email help offered.

The website can give advice on the recovery of business debts.

fields.how_to_use: Refer clients seeking advice to website
fields.keywords: debt, helpline, self employed, director, bankruptcy, bankrupt, insolvent, insolvency, business, debtline, bailiff, bailiffs, landlords, debt recovery

fields.description:
The CQC is the new health and adult social care regulator for England. It aims to ensure better care for everyone in hospital, in a care home or at home.

The CQC regulates services provided by the NHS, local councils, private companies and voluntary organisations.
If offers:

* advice on making a complaint about a health or care service provider.
* information about services currently available.
* information about the standards and regulations that a care service provider should meet
fields.accessibility: Email, Browsealoud, some information in other formats and languages, including BSL

fields.how_to_use: Refer those who are able to self help to website and those who need assistance to helpline.

fields.description:
support to all members of the LGBT communities, their family, friends, and agencies supporting them. They can: provide confidential information, advice and support 
help you create your safety plan 
explore options around housing, legal advice, counselling and local support groups 
tell you about your local LGBT friendly services 
discuss the possibility of reporting to the Police

fields.type_of_service: Escalated complaints about legal advice providers
fields.description:
The Legal Ombudsman for England and Wales provides a service to all members of the public, very small businesses, charities, clubs and trusts. Their service is free to these consumers. 

The ombudsman's job is to deal with legal complaints about services provided by lawyers (solicitors, legal executives, licensed conveyancers etc) and the service is independent and impartial.
fields.when_to_use: For clients who want to complain about legal advice services
fields.how_to_use: To be used as a supplement to category-specific referrals

Legal Ombudsman
PO Box 6806,
Wolverhampton,
WV1 9WJ
fields.keywords: office, legal, services, ombudsman, solicitor, solicitors, attorney, conveyancer, complaint, complaints

fields.description:
The Ministry of Justice is the parent body of the Legal Services Commission, a non-departmental government body which administers legal aid in England and Wales. 

The MOJ provides funding to the LSC, which in turn funds Civil Legal Advice.
fields.when_to_use: Read out the description to anyone who is asking about how legal aid is funded.
fields.how_to_use: To be used as supplement to category specific referrals. Refer those looking for more information.
fields.keywords: ministry of justice, MOJ, legal aid

fields.description:
Government department responsible for legal aid policy.

For clients who are not happy with eligibility limits for legal aid and would like to complaint about this. 

This address should only be used for complaints about legal aid policy matters - you should direct all other case-specific enquiries about existing legal aid certificates to the LSC General Enquiry Line.

fields.description:
The Ombudsman Association provides information for the general public about what ombudsmen are, how they work, and what you can expect when you take your complaint to the ombudsman. 

The association can also tell you how to complain about the administration of organisations like your local council, banks, estate agents, lawyers, and the NHS.
fields.when_to_use: For clients looking for complaints bodies or an ombudsman.
fields.how_to_use: To be used as supplement to category specific referrals. Refer those wishing to search for relevant complaints body or Ombudsman
fields.keywords: british, irish, ombudsman, association, complain, complaint, ombudsmans

fields.description:
Victim Supportline offers free confidential and anonymous support for anyone affected by crime, regardless of whether the crime has been reported to the police or not. 

The Supportline directly refers people to their local Victim Support scheme for:

* practical and face-to-face support
* someone to talk to in confidence
* information on police and court procedures 
* help in dealing with other organisations 
* information about compensation and insurance 
* links to other sources of help
* advice for witnesses of crime

Victim Supportline welcomes email enquiries.
fields.accessibility: Email, Text Relay and interpretation.
fields.when_to_use: For clients who have been the victims of crime and need support.
fields.how_to_use: To be used as supplement to category-specific referrals
fields.address:
The Supportline address for letters only is:
Hannibal House
Elephant and Castle Shopping Centre
London
SE1 6TB
fields.keywords:
helpline, crime, compensation, support, violence,
domestic, criminal, injury, stalk, stalking, witness, dv, victim, supportline
fields.opening_hours: 9am - 9pm Monday to Friday, 9am - 7pm weekends, 9am - 5pm bank holidays

fields.type_of_service: Women and children experiencing, or who have experienced, domestic violence Friends and family seeking to support women and children who are experiencing, or who have experienced, domestic violence Professionals supporting women and children experiencing domestic violence.
fields.description:
The helpline is an emergency service and is not intended to offer general information on domestic violence. Helpline staff respond according to the caller's needs and may refer women (with or without children) to emergency safe accommodation. 

They also provide information about legal, housing or welfare rights and options and referral to relevant services and professions.

Helpline staff can offer emotional support and (if appropriate) refer callers to counselling services. 

As well as offering confidential support and information, helpline staff can provide practical help and information about housing rights and entitlements, information on getting injunctions or reassurance about calling the police.
fields.accessibility: Interpretation service available. Type Talk for calers with hearing difficulties. Womens Aid and Refuge websites provide some information in other languages
fields.when_to_use: Emergency service for women and children who are experiencing, or have experienced, domestic violence. Offer in addition to other resources, including referral to CLA specialist.
fields.how_to_use: To be used as supplement to category specific referrals
fields.address: helpline@womensaid.org.uk (limited information only, respond within 3 days)
fields.opening_hours: 24 hours a day, 365 days a year
